meanings.definition: To hold back from action; keep in check or under control.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to restrain the excited students from running in the hallway.
meanings.sent2: The police officer used handcuffs to restrain the criminal.
meanings.sent3: Trying to restrain a giggling fit during a serious meeting was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure restrained her from taking risks in her career.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind restrained the kite from flying higher.

meanings.definition: To prevent from doing something; restrict.
meanings.sent1: Please restrain yourself from eating all the cookies before the party.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised him to restrain from lifting heavy objects after the surgery.
meanings.sent3: She had to restrain her laughter during the sad movie to avoid disturbing others.
meanings.sent4: His conscience restrained him from cheating on the exam.
meanings.sent5: The fence restrained the dog from wandering off the property.

meanings.sent1: The company had to restrain their expenses to stay within budget.
meanings.sent2: The new law aims to restrain the use of plastic bags to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: His love for chocolate had to be restrained to avoid gaining too much weight.
meanings.sent4: The rules in place restrained the players from using unfair tactics.
meanings.sent5: The doctor advised him to restrain his salt intake for better health.
